risks.title: No Minimum Base Compensation
risks.description: The contract does not specify a minimum base compensation amount, suggesting the contractor may receive little or no pay if projects/sales are limited.
risks.recommendation: Negotiate to include a reasonable minimum base salary or retainer to ensure some guaranteed income.

risks.title: Immediate Termination Causes
risks.description: The contract allows for immediate termination for vaguely defined reasons like 'Poor-Quality Work', giving the company broad discretion.
risks.recommendation: Request clearly defined quality standards and a notice/cure period before termination for 'Poor-Quality Work' type issues.

risks.title: Unlimited Contractor Liability
risks.description: The contract does not cap the contractor's liability for indemnification obligations, potentially exposing them to significant financial risk.
risks.recommendation: Negotiate to include a reasonable liability cap aligned with the contractor's fee or access to insurance coverage.

risks.title: No Notice Period for Termination
risks.description: The contract allows for immediate termination by the company without any notice period for the contractor.
risks.recommendation: Request a reasonable notice period (e.g. 30 days) before termination to provide transition time.

risks.title: Perpetual Confidentiality Obligation
risks.description: The confidentiality obligations last perpetually, which may be unreasonable for some types of information.
risks.recommendation: Negotiate time limits on confidentiality, such as 3-5 years after contract termination, for certain non-sensitive information.

risks.title: Non-Solicitation of Unspecified Parties
risks.description: The non-solicitation clause covers unspecified customers, employees, and suppliers, which may be overly broad.
risks.recommendation: Request that the non-solicitation be limited to parties directly involved with the contractor's work for the company.
